A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Age 13\, the original trilogy\, which I'd already loved\, was re-released\, which meant I got to obtain a vhs copy of my own\, albeit with some shoddy expansions. I would get up at 6am each day for months to watch all or part of one of the films before school. I read the extended universe books in depth\, and cried myself to sleep that it wasn't real. I was thoroughly obsessed with the magic of Star Wars\, and it was a governing force for a long time. 

The fixation faded over time\, mostly due to life getting in the way\, but a little to do with Lord of the Rings being such a strong competitor for my affections. But also\, that was 20 years ago. How long can that level of intensity last?

Well it turns out that with a sufficient reboot\, it can totally reignite! And while I LOVED The Force Awakens\, and Rogue One\, it wasn't until The Last Jedi that that wonder and excitement and involvement fully returned to me. It's such a wonderful and nostalgic feeling to reconnect with!

Only this time\, I see women at the fore\, and the roles I wish child-me had been offered in heroes are all starting to be real. It's almost enough that I get to see it in my lifetime. 

The locations\, flora and fauna are excellent (though possibly demonstrate a subtle vegan agenda?) the new characters all add vital points to the narrative\, little is wasted. It's a long film\, but for me I adored every moment and didn't feel the time at all! Truly magical!
